website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and low-profile, this hardwired charger boasts an on-unit delay timer, but lacks Wi-Fi capability.
pros: Hardwired charger that can reduce EV charging time to around 3 hours, rather than 12 to 15
Time delay can be set directly on the unit
Clear and bright charge indicator lights
At 14 feet, charger cable usually reaches EV within the garage
cons: Will need a professional electrician to wire to the appropriate high-amp circuit
Outer casing seems more flimsy than other brands
Included charger cord may not reach cars parked outside the garage, so consider ordering a larger cable

customer_reviews.title: Fragile and Unrepairable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Unit stopped working after 3 months. Siemens refused to assist because the unit wasn't installed in an airtight moisture proof garage which according to them voids the warranty. They also don't fix this model and claim its not fixable if an error code comes up. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiko B.

customer_reviews.title: Apparently mine is a dud
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing redeeming about this EVSE. I attempted to use this station six times and of those only three were successful. I've installed and used units from PEP, Clipper Creek, Tesla, Schneider, etc. and have never had an issue getting a charge. To say this unit's reliability is suspect would be an understatement. It's construction is suspect as well due to the front cover falling off. (see photo)
customer_reviews.author: M. VanSumeren

customer_reviews.title: So far so great, very pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate, works great with my BMW i3. At 50%, charges my EV to full in less than 2hours. Direct wire not an issue (cheaper), why pay the added cost for the plug/pre-wired unit and a receptacle. Read some complaints about the short cord... call me crazy, but I just installed mine within 14ft of my EV. Also, easy to customize (see pic), lol. Will never go back to the wall outlet, level 2 charging is soooooooo much better.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy G.

customer_reviews.title: It just works!
customer_reviews.text: I charge a Nissan Leaf Plus. When we built the house I had the garage prewired so I bought the hardwired version of this charger. Mounted it on the wall over the electrical box, connected the wires per instructions, started charging. This is a basic charger, no wifi, no timers, etc. - but my car controls the charge, has timers, communicates it's charge status by wifi, lets me start/stop charges with my phone. Why would I pay extra for an intelligent charger? The Siemens is a good, solid, well built charger with easy controls and great cord storage.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good charger
customer_reviews.text: Bought to put in our garage to use with a Fusion Energi. My husband installed it himself, but wished the directions were a little clearer. He thought a plug was included, but when he got down to working on it, it was not and he had to rethink how he was going to wire it. He had to hard wire it instead. Once it was installed, he likes that you can choose how fast it charges. He keeps it on 2 hours and it charges his car fully in that amount of time. It is quiet and I like that is lights up so you know that it is charging.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mohar

customer_reviews.title: Meant for "indoor" use, but so far no problems.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for about 9 months now with no issue. I was a little surprised to find out that it is only intended for indoor use. That seems like a huge oversight considered vehicles generally stay outdoors. My workaround was to go out and buy a small vinyl garden tool shed and installed it inside of it. So far, no issues. It was relatively easy to install. You will need to run your own power cable or run a 240 line to power it.
customer_reviews.author: the_hangman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Like: Seems to be very good quality and will likely last forever. For the price it is the best out there. I like the charging indicator lights and the looks of the unit. Easy to mount and simple to use. Dislike: Makes a harsh pop when starting to charge. At first thought it was a breaker tripping but seems normal for the unit. Does not really matter but it may startle you at first since this is high voltage. Regardless I love the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne D

customer_reviews.title: excellent value compared to other products in this category
customer_reviews.text: Great charger for a fraction of the price most others are. When shopping around for a 240v charger, most were double this price, and I could not figure out why. Only thing I could figure out was it has a shorter power cord than most. I mounted this indoor my garage just to the side of my garage door. I back my car (Fiat 500e) into the driveway, and cable is plenty long to plug in. Installed on a dedicated 40 amp breaker panel that was originally setup for a welder. Charges car dead to full in about 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: rothchilds

customer_reviews.title: Just works well!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the hard-wired model and installed it myself by adding a new circuit breaker and running a long electrical wire by myself. It took me about 2 hours to finish as an amateur. This charger just works and is simple enough to install. The design is clean and simple. I like that it has a mount to park the charger head and the charging cable can wrap around the unit itself. Very clean design. I use it for my BMW i3 and cannot be happier. This is the best one to buy for your electric car.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Chan

customer_reviews.title: Set to 75W
customer_reviews.text: Electrician was concerned as you can change the setting for how much power goes out- I directed them to max it out per factory settings allowable and my BMW I3 charges to full charge in 2.5 hours, which is awesome compared to regular plug in and setting all night before back to full charge. You are basically putting this port on a 220 connection, same as you would for your dryer. Also emits cool glowing light indicating when charging and I can climatize the Beamer off the app on my phone. Technology, baby!
customer_reviews.author: Hayes Murray

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE, RELIABLE PERFORMANCE, CRITICALLY BAD INSTRUCTIONS
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our Chevy Bolt and it's been flawless for a number of months now. I knocked off points for installation because the directions use the WRONG COLORS in the wiring diagram, switching hot and neutral! Be really careful with this—I don't know, but I wonder if I would have blown it up had I not checked and re-checked the wiring several times before turning on the power.
customer_reviews.author: Marc99

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Fast to install
customer_reviews.text: This auto charger is the perfect item for recharging electric cars. I have a Ford C-Max and it loves the Siemens VersiCharge as well. I set it to charge late at night when the electric current is less expensive, and it does a GREAT job. Even during the day when you need an extra charge, this machine does it in short time. I wired it directly to a 220 slot in my garage circuit box and was in business in short time. Instruction are good and clear and I was able to be up and going in just a few hours. Thanks Siemens!
customer_reviews.author: Ed B

customer_reviews.title: easy and versatile to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit for our Nissan Leaf. I had a friend who is a licensed electrician install it, although after seeing him wire it, I could have done it myself. Our electrical rates decrease from 8pm to 8am, so the delay timer is a nice feature. I have 2 criticisms: The unit itself is very high quality (our electrician was impressed), but the mounting plate seems a bit cheesy. Second, if you pause the charger to disconnect a vehicle, say to run a quick errand, the charger will not start automatically when you plug it back in again- you need to press the pause button a second time. Both very minor concerns- I'd still highly recommend this charger.
customer_reviews.author: sci teacher

customer_reviews.title: Quality control deficient
customer_reviews.text: The unit was installed by an electrician and was hard wired because it replaced another hard wired unit. After many trials and contact with the Siemens technical services rep , we thought the the unit was defective. When the electrician opened the unit, we discovered the unit was set at 7.5 amps. We adjusted the unit to 22.5 amps. The unit now charges the vehicle. In addition, the faceplate fell off fell off on a regular basis. Siemens sent me a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Norman J. Slawsky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price. You can spend much more for fancier or trendy looking units. This was simple to install (did the work with my brother in a few hours). This is a hard wired unit - not a plug in. We installed it on the exterior wall of my house. It blinks green while charging and I can see the reflection in the kitchen window at night. This unit also has a timer so you could delay charging - handy if you have an off peak hour charging rate. I haven't used that feature myself. Super easy to use. Come home, plug in. Wake up, unplug and drive away with a full charge.
customer_reviews.author: Pisces Girl

customer_reviews.title: Bad handle design on this Siemens EV charger
customer_reviews.text: Broken handle right out of the box. Seems like poor quality plastic and design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Tesla owners beware!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Tesla and a Volt. Works with the Volt but not the Tesla. After many calls with Siemens and a replacement unit, it still doesn’t work. The Tesla charges on every other level 2 charger that I have tried it on. The Tesla has also been checked by the manufacturer and works properly. Tesla owners beware!
customer_reviews.author: Tom in California

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit for Honda Clarity
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot of strength and jimmying to get this plug into the receptacle of my Honda Clarity Hybrid, and even more struggle to remove it. By contrast the low level plug that came with the vehicle slides in and out smoothly. DIdn't discover this until it was wall mounted and connected.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Linnehan

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should do, but not impressed with the plug latch breaking on the first week i had it.
customer_reviews.text: I've only been using this for a week and already the plastic connector that is on the plug broke. I'll be filling a service request with Siemens and see if that gets corrected/fixed and update my review. Beyond my unenthusiastic start of breaking the plug latch my first week, it does what it says it should do. It charges my EV super quick compared to 110v plug.
customer_reviews.author: Byron D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Broken clip/lock
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, initially for a month. Then the Clip to lock it in the holster or vehicle snapped off. Just made of plastic. Contacted Siemens a few times, no response. Can no longer clip the plug up and it doesn't lock to car. Poor design as there are others comments about it breaking. Its too far to ship it back from Australia to the US on the off chance they may replace the plug. Even offered to pay freight on a replacement plug that I would get an electrician to fit here, no response. Not professional at all Siemens!
customer_reviews.author: Stewart M.

customer_reviews.title: Quick charge.
customer_reviews.text: Anyone that thinks they are going to charge an electric vehicle with a 110 line is sadly mistaken. Sometimes overnight doesn't do it. This charging station is fabulous. I hired an electrician to install a 220 line in the garage. Cost,,$600. Well worth it. My car now charges fully in about 2 hours. This siemens unit is low profile and very very nice. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Antoinette Perrie

customer_reviews.title: I particularly liked the option of direct connecting the wiring without necessitating ...
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the detailed level of installation instructions provided on the included USB memory stick. I was able to install the additional 240 volt circuit breaker and run the wiring to my garage in about half a day. I particularly liked the option of direct connecting the wiring without necessitating a 240 volt outlet and plug.
customer_reviews.author: JimM

customer_reviews.title: Might not buy again if I had to choose
customer_reviews.text: Has a "secret" feature that allows it to be used at lower power, which is great. It looks fine, works fine - but the latch failed after a few uses. They're willing to replace it in warranty (the whole unit, not the small part) but it's too much hassle to disconnect and return it.
customer_reviews.author: -scott

customer_reviews.title: No support.
customer_reviews.text: It only worked for a month. The company won't repair, replace, or reimburse. I explained where I installed it and that I can't afford to keep replacing car chargers. Their response was too bad. I can't recommend a product the company won't stand behind.
customer_reviews.author: LadyJane1949

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered quickly and FREE (thanks Amazon Prime!) and was ridiculously easy to install. I got the hardwire model, and after a quick trip to Lowe's for a breaker and some cable I was able to get it up and running in around 45 minutes. So far it's running very reliably and does exactly what it's supposed to do--charge the batteries in my Volt.
customer_reviews.author: steinhausmin

customer_reviews.title: Working Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Working perfectly. I have been using this unit for two months now. It is real nice to change my Leaf in 3 hours as apposed to 10 hours. Installation was easy. I had an electrician put in the 40 amp 220v breaker and run the line to a dryer plug sized receptacle box.Since this model is a direct wire, He just ran enough line to wire it into the unit. Update: 8 months of use and all is still wonderful. Update 2: 12/18/17 2.5 years and still working wonderfully. Now charging my Chevy Bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kent

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my ELR 4 hr charge on the Voltec ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for $389 installed near panel in garage in 3 hrs ( including trip to Lowes) plug -n-play can't beat the price. I used 8/2 wire an 6-50 plug and connector for $40. Works great with my ELR 4 hr charge on the Voltec power train..
customer_reviews.author: Frederick

customer_reviews.title: Siemens Verischarge 30 amp electric!
customer_reviews.text: This has been working fantastic! It cost a lot of money but, it was really worth it, to be able to charge our Volt! Happy beyond belief!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Harmon

customer_reviews.title: This Charger is Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: This Charger is Excellent! Very easy to install.. Very Light weight nice to work with. I wired up using Number 10 Thn wire Per Phase.. . Unit amps out at around 15 amps per Leg. measuring with a Amp Clamp.. I Did not have to make any fine adjustments. I am using it to Charge My 2012 Nissan leaf.. Ahead of it , I have a simple Fused Disconnect at 30 amps purchased at Menards for about $20 bucks.. uses screw in fuses..
customer_reviews.author: John Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Cool glowing green light that pulses when charging
customer_reviews.text: Well built, but large. Mine says assembled in USA (yay!) Be advised this did not include an inside strain / cable clamp if you're going the route of a cord to the 240v outlet. Cool glowing green light that pulses when charging. Wish it had the lighted handle like my stock Volt charger, but this one is twice as fast. Is it possible that charging with 240v is more efficient? My electric bill seems to have gone down as well, and I'm pretty sure I'm getting a few more charges in the past few months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HARDWIRED only despite picture showing otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I think it's important to note that this charger is described as hardwired however there is an imagine where it is plugged into a wall outlet. I believe this is an image from it's more expensive version and that should be addressed. I returned this one to buy the plug version and am quite happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking HIGH TECH Charger
customer_reviews.text: Had electrician out yesterday. Installation went great. New double 40 AMP circuit with #8 wire. Laundry circuit was only 30 AMP and not heavy enough wire--not recommended. Works perfectly. Like the green led glow lighting when it's charging. Installed for my 2016 Volt. Now 3 -4 hours instead of 14 -16 hours and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Ddub

customer_reviews.title: Siemens Level 2 charger
customer_reviews.text: Versicharge was professionally installed by Advanced Electric (West Hills CA) and is working efficiently and correctly to charge my car. I use the timer function to delay charging until low base rate hours. The level 2 charger takes little time to achieve full charge on my 7.6 Kwh hybrid battery.
customer_reviews.author: D. Berkus

customer_reviews.title: Works Well With 2015 LEAF
customer_reviews.text: We are using this on our 2015 Nissan Leaf. So far so good. I've been very pleased with the installation, which I did myself. It was very easy to install and looks very nice on the wall in my garage. The price was very good for a 40 amp unit and I cannot find any fault with it. I think you'd be hard pressed to find another charger that offers this capability for a better price.
customer_reviews.author: DFS3

customer_reviews.title: Very fast charging.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a weekend to charge my Bolt using a level one charger that came with the car. I ordered this one based upon reviews and reputation of Siemens. Easy to wire into my panel. Complete charge in less than a night. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this daily now for several months and it works as expected. At first we didn't realize that tilting the handle slightly downward facilitates getting the nozzle into and out of the charger more easily--once you get the hang of this, it works great. Can't beat the price. It was easily installed by our electrician.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: More than adequate.
customer_reviews.text: We didn’t need anything fancy, and this does more than we need it to. Requires absolutely nothing except plugging it into the car (Nissan Leaf) to operate. Easy to install if you’re not intimidated by running a 220V line to it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Ferry

customer_reviews.title: Works with 2014 Nissan Leaf
customer_reviews.text: Using it to charge a 2014 Nissan Leaf SL we purchased used a week ago. So far no problems. I ran the circuit myself using 8/2 Romex ($1.50/ft) and a 40A breaker ($9) purchased from Lowes. It was a "used Amazon Wearhouse Deal" and advertised with noticeable scratches but the product that arrived looked absolutely brand new. Using the 110V charger now seems crazy going from 20hrs to 4hrs if it needs a complete charge. The 110V trickle charger will go in the trunk in case we get stranded away from home or a public L2 charger. Now the wife has an excuse to park in the wood shop again. :)
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Handle & Clip Breaks & Feels Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Works okay as a charger but the clip broke and I can't get it out of my car. With how cheaply made this clip/handle is, they should offer to replace just the clip when it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Great charger and no more worrying!
customer_reviews.text: Great charger for the price! Had the electrician put a wall plug cord on it for $15 instead of hardwiring to the circuit breaker. I am glad I purchased this for my 2015 Leaf. Now my average charge time is 2.5 hours instead of 12-15 hours on a 110 volt wall plug for a full charge. Not afraid to use my car on Sunday's and worrying about charging time for the next day. Charger works great and like the design.
customer_reviews.author: Don K.

customer_reviews.title: Solid charger with good warranty
customer_reviews.text: I chose this unit for 3 reasons: the 3-year warranty, the timer feature, and the trustworthy brand (Siemens). I have not been disappointed. It's very solid and reliable. I will say that it's very functional in look and not as attractive as the Blink unit (which also has a timer but only a 1-year warranty), but it's in my garage, so I'm the only one that looks at it. The cord is very strong. In case you're interested, the codes stamped on the cord read as follows: (UL) E345037 TYPE EVE 105°C 600V 3C/ 10 AWG (5.26 mm2) AND 1C/20 AWG
customer_reviews.author: Purist

customer_reviews.title: No power plug
customer_reviews.text: Notice this one does not come with the wire/power plug. Had to return. Looks like the package we got was from someone who returned it too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charging time cut in half
customer_reviews.text: This has been wonderful. I have a Chevy Volt and this helps reduce the charge time in half. Great buy and so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Darin

customer_reviews.title: 2015 Nissan Leaf
customer_reviews.text: Works great to charge my 2015 Nissan Leaf. In my area hooked to 220 it’s about .53 cents an hour to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff

customer_reviews.title: Vey happy with the unit and how it functions
customer_reviews.text: Reduced my charge time on my 2014 BMW i3 from several hours to 2. What else can you say, when you own an EV this is a game changer. Vey happy with the unit and how it functions. Very simple to operate, works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Jims5543

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Not a good product. Not happy with it's quality and it's design. Didn't work when it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills 240v EV charger
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for my Volt. Charges in 4:15. Nothing fancy, although it lights up pretty. Pay attention to cord length, 14ft is not that long. For me it was perfect because I mounted it 3ft from my charge port, but I won't be able to park outside and charge it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy S. Fudo

customer_reviews.title: Best EV car charger
customer_reviews.text: Best price in easiest to get shipped E V car charger. Best car charger on the market. Easy install
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Makes Charging Your EV Easy
customer_reviews.text: After it was installed by an electrician it was easy to use
customer_reviews.author: rona schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and connect in my garage
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and connect in my garage. It charges my Leaf just as quickly as the far more expensive ChargePoint unit it replaced. The unit itself does feel a little cheaply built in comparison, and the charger cable is not quite as long as I would like. If it had a sturdier shell I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amused to Death

customer_reviews.title: Love this charger
customer_reviews.text: Love this charger. The deferred timer is a very cool option. It will charge your car in 3-4 hrs. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: AMoney

customer_reviews.title: Level 2 charger
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect and the timer feature does come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Ted M. Bonner

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take up much space, easy to use, timer feature is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Delia Hogan

customer_reviews.title: This thing rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 2018 chevy bolt premier. Easy to hook up and mount. It charges my car in 6 hours. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: LDWesty

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for garage charging for my new Audi e tron. An electrician installed it in just a few hours. Very reasonably price.
customer_reviews.author: Ted B.

customer_reviews.title: I have only had the unit for two days installed ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the unit for two days installed. The second time I used it the black plastic piece on the connector broke off. I have e-mailed the company to see if I can get a replacement piece as I do not wish to hire an electrician to remove what he installed yesterday Other than this problem the unit is ok.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Fast charging
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I now charge my i3 in less than 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: JAVIER

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Arrived just as advertised. Hardwire install in the garage per the instructions. Really looking forward to having the climate timer in the Leaf work now with more power available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It looks cool
customer_reviews.text: It took about 1 hour to hook up. I have a retired electrician brother who did it. Its a brand name so I'm not worried about hurting my new car. The cost was about the same as others.
customer_reviews.author: Fred P. Doppler, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great but didn't come with a piece to attach it to outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Keto Alice

customer_reviews.title: Electric Vehicle Charger
customer_reviews.text: So happy it arrived quickly and was easy for the electrician to install. It charges my 2015 Chevy Volt to a full charge within four hours, a major improvement over the portable charging cable it came with the car that took 10 or so hours to charge completely.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Love this charger
customer_reviews.text: Love this charger. Price was better then most and it was very easy to get installed. It takes half the time to charge our car then it did with the conventional Smart car plug. I like the space ship look when the lights are letting you know it is still charging.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Thorley

customer_reviews.title: Good Value, Siemens Quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, charges quickly. Just enough functionality to make it flexible to use.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dundas

customer_reviews.title: Works great, my electrician charged $150 to wire it up
customer_reviews.text: Works great, my electrician charged $150 to wire it up, our panel was close by. Makes a huge difference instead of only using regular plug. Very easy to install and very basic to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EV Charger Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: This charger was easily installed by our electrician. The unit works very well And is simple to use. I recommend it to EV owners...
customer_reviews.author: Pcushenan

customer_reviews.title: Charges Ford Fusion Energi 2017 with no issue about 2 to 2.5 hrs. The setup was ease.
customer_reviews.text: Charges Ford Fusion Energi 2017 with no issue about 2 to 2.5 hrs. The setup was ease.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the Siemens chargers
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chargers and had them installed in my garage just over a year ago and they are working perfectly. I highly recommend the Siemens chargers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Lanctot

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking stage 2 chatged
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one slightly used was not working, I replay ce with newer one ,performing good.you need to install the inlet cable and connections, but easy to install .
customer_reviews.author: MANZAR QAYYUM

customer_reviews.title: Great price, nice features.
customer_reviews.text: Love the timer. A bit difficult getting the nozzle out of the unit otherwise it's well worth the price. Glowing light while the unit is charging is a nice touch. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: marduk

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly on my wifes 2016 BMW i3. You ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my wifes 2016 BMW i3. You can delay the charge timer up 8 hours for the lower electrical rates. :)
customer_reviews.author: Snuwk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does the job and I love the timer function so I can delay the charging time.
customer_reviews.author: Ken King

customer_reviews.title: Charger works well with new Volt
customer_reviews.text: The charger arrived on time and in good condition. I had it installed and it works well with my new Volt - full charge in 4.5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pass

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cut my charging down from 26 hours to just 4.5!
customer_reviews.author: Gmtidwell

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Love the delay option for charging. Very easy to install and use. Great product and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, just needed basic understanding of electricity. Running the line from panel took about 1 hour, mounting and wiring of unit was less than 15 minutes. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Leaf98275

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice charger works well with my new Kia Soul EV.
customer_reviews.author: Adirondaker

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This makes my charging time much faster. Good product. Would recommend it to anyone who has a plug in Vehicle. I have a Chevy Volt and it works great with my car.
customer_reviews.author: Wil Dredge

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and great charger
customer_reviews.text: Installed it myself. Easy once I got the wire run from the panel. Works great and charges the Chevy Bolt fully within 10 hours
customer_reviews.author: Willie T

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Product. Easy install. I charger my car for less than 3 hours.
customer_reviews.author: George A. Ivanov

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and have been using for 18 months with no issues. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pa2174

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: Great charger! Price was right, installation didn't take long and charges our gen 2 Volt as fast as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Parris

customer_reviews.title: I have a BMW i3 and I love that I can delay charging time on the actual ...
customer_reviews.text: Never lets me down. I have a BMW i3 and I love that I can delay charging time on the actual unit. You can do it with the car but it’s not as convenient as just pressing the button on the actual charger and walking away. I’m not an electrician so I have no clue how to install but the friend that did it for me, said it was relatively simple.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Crouse

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Husband installed it himself
customer_reviews.text: Charges the car in 2 hours. Love it. Husband installed it himself!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Great Charger
customer_reviews.text: The Versicharger lives up to it's promise. It has many features that I am just now learning to use. The Mopar charger that Chrysler sells is over twice the cost without the features which enables cell phone interaction.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon has terrible electrical customer service
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap doesn’t work after 3 months of use. No help from amazon, no help from manufacturer. DO NOT BUY

customer_reviews.text: So, when ordering this product keep in mind that when you will get it you will be extremely dissapinted because this product comes WITHOUT power cable.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Charges faster than most of the commercial level 2 chargers.

customer_reviews.title: EVSE for Nissan Leaf or any other Electric car level 2
customer_reviews.text: So far units works as expected easy to use reasonable For a EVSE unit but 399 would be better price considering the internal circuitry these are not nearly as Complicated as I first imagined but safety is important So maybe I am being cheap easy to install try to get It installed for 200 if you can find a electrician who is reasonable only takes a hour and half for his labor I paid for parts breaker and 8-2 wire he fished the wire and added breaker to box

customer_reviews.title: very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Great charger works well charges Leaf in2-3 hrs with no problem. easy to have wired up and inspected. Love it. Love Siemens name and would buy another with no 2nd thoughts

customer_reviews.text: Solid EVSE at a great price. Easy installation. Works great with the 2014 Nissan Leaf.

customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works like a charm. Highest rated charging system of all out there. Simple to install yourself as well.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home EV charging
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, installed easily, and performs exactly as described. The cord is long enough to reach pretty much anywhere in the garage, but not so long that it gets in the way.

customer_reviews.title: Great low price quality product
customer_reviews.text: Great low price quality product ..does not have the Wi-Fi connect .. But does have the Wi-Fi button .. I didn't really want the Wi-Fi anyway .. If you want to deal through Siemens don't buy it from Amazon because Siemens will not talk to you .. Siemens does not want to answer any questions nor do they want to help you out with the product .. Through Amazon I got a great deal to hook up the charger for under $100

product_meta.title: Siemens US2:VC30GRYHW VersiCharge Hard-Wired (VC30GRYHW) : Fast Charging, Easy Installation, Flexible Control, Award Winning, UL Listed, J1772 Compatibility, 14ft Cable, Hard-Wired
product_meta.description:
Material Type:New

SIEMENS VC30GRYHW VERSICHARGE 30-AMP ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGER
 SIEMENS VERSICHARGE ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGERS
Founded more than 165 years ago, Siemens is a worldwide industry leader in electronics and electrical engineering, dedicated to innovation, quality, and reliability in the fields of energy, industry, and healthcare. Standing for technological excellence and delivering infrastructure solutions, Siemens is the world’s chief supplier of environmental technologies, with about 40 percent of its total revenue coming from green products and solutions. VersiCharge is just one more best in class product in the green energy sector to be developed by Siemens.

VersiCharge is available in plug in (VC30GRU) and hard wired options (VC30GRHW) VersiCharge makes it easier than ever to incorporate energy efficient practices into your home  VERSICHARGE SELECTION
The Siemens 30-A Level II VersiCharge electric vehicle charger is available in two configurations – Hardwire for indoor use only (VC30GRYHW) and Universal which can be used indoors and outside (VC30GRYU). The Universal unit arrives ready to plug in for use into a 240V receptacle and is easily attachable to most surfaces with the provided mounting bracket.

 CHARGING CONVENIENCE
Most EV batteries will be charged from zero to full in less than 3.5 hours, leaving plenty of time to delay your charge by 2-8 hours with the easy to use time of charge delay feature on the unit. Additional features like the status indicating LED Halo visible from a distance and a clean cord management solution will leave you even more satisfied when you get into your fully charged EV every day.

 CHOOSE WHICHEVER INSTALLATION IS RIGHT FOR YOU
The Universal VersiCharge is equipped with a plug and cord assembly which can either be plugged into a suitably sized double-gang receptacle below or behind the unit. The plug and cord assembly can be detached from the unit for a hardwired installation. For an indoor only hardwire application, we recommend the more cost effective VersiCharge hardwire version (VC30GRYHW). Not only does this easy plug and play installation enable you to take your VersiCharge on the road with you, but it comes equipped with a mounting bracket and other hardware for permanent installation at home in your garage, carport, or parking pad. The weatherproof NEMA 4 enclosure, made of 60 percent recycled material with matte finish, is designed to withstand the elements no matter its location. The unit’s standard SAE J1772 connector is ergonomic for user comfort and an integrated holster keeps debris and dust out of the plug for clean and convenient usage. The attached 20-foot cord (14 foot for Hardwire only) wraps over the top of the enclosure for expedient, clean storage.

 MAKING ENERGY EFFICIENCY EASY
The VersiCharge is jam packed with user-friendly features that make it easier than ever to efficiently and economically charge your electric vehicle. Monitor the status of your vehicle’s charge with help from the LED color indication halo that’s visible from across the garage and displays the stage at which your charge stands, from ready to charge to charging to fully charged. As demand response utility plans increase in popularity, inquire with your utility about utilizing the VersiCharge low voltage connection to enroll your charger in potential savings programs offered by your utility. Further adjust charging status to specifically fit your schedule and electricity bill budget with help from the delay timer functionality, which allows you to postpone charging for up to eight hours from the time of plug-in with the press of a button. Regardless of when you choose to charge, the VersiCharge power output can be adjusted to complement the outlet’s capability, ranging in increments from a maximum power setting of 7.2 kW to 1.8 kW. Plus, by delivering adjustable, extended amperage options, the VersiCharge keeps up with evolving electric vehicle technology, helping to future proof compatibility over time. If you are looking for speed, please refer to the table below to compare the amount of miles charged in a certain time period by your VersiCharge over a Level I charger and other seemingly competitive products.

VersiCharge is a Level 2, 30 Amp Max charger, providing the fastest level of charging  WHAT IS IN THE BOX
One Siemens 30-amp VersiCharge electric vehicle charger, one mounting bracket, and a digital manual on reusable USB stick. 240V receptacle that mounts in the wall of the home NOT included and must be purchased separately from a receptacle manufacturer.


 HIGHLIGHTS
 * Compatible with all plug-in electric vehicles (SAE J1772 vehicle plug)
 * 30-amp, 240-volt Level II charging capability cuts charge time in half versus Level I
 * User-friendly installation, design, and functionality
 * Flexible wiring options—bottom-fed and rear-fed—for flexible configuration
 * Dimensions: 16.5 inches by 16.5 inches by 6.5 inches; weighs 21 pounds
 * Demand Response capability to take advantage of utility savings programs
 * Underwriters Laboratories (UL) listed for quality standards
feature_bullets: Quicker charging (30 Amps, 240V, Level 2): 4x faster charging than Level 1, 120V chargers. Operating temperature : minus 30 degree Celsius to plus 50 degree Celsius

Easier set-up: Includes convenient mounting bracket, 14ft charging cable, and hardwired installation (electrician recommended). You can stop charging at any time. We recommend you press the "Pause" button on the charging station when you want to stop a charge cycle currently in process.
Flexible control: Pause and 2/4/6/8 hour delay functions built into the front of the charger. Operating humidity - Maximum 95% non-condensing
Built to last: Industry leading 3-year warranty for indoor use, and manufactured in California.Operating temperature:-30°C to +50° C
Universal compatibility: Works with all J1772 complying cars and also Tesla vehicles using Tesla’s charging adapter.
Award winning: Rated as The Wirecutter’s “Best EV Charging Station” of 2017.
A name you can trust: Siemens has been a technology leader for over 170 years.
